Payment Processing loop unable to pay



  • 2009-06-22 19:06:09

    Payment Processing loop unable to pay

    I have students trying to pay for a course. Once logged in they receive a message, Requires Instructor Approval. They click OK, they get a blank page. This is an email I got that explains this better.
    >>>>
    If I try to click on payments without enrolling, I am not able to pay....as I have not enrolled yet.
    In order to enroll, I have to click on the Request Enrollement link. This brings me to a completely blank page.
    In order to pay, I have to go back to the home page and login and then, click on the payments tab.

    Is there anyway to bypass this blank page, and go right to the page with the payments tab? I think the blank page will confuse a lot of people. And it requires a few extra steps of loggin back into the site to pay. <<<

    Does anybody have any ideas? I created a test account and was able to pay but after payment, I get an error message that "Payment was either denied or cancelled" however, it is confusing because if I clikc on the course it allows me in.

    Please help. This is really frustrating to a lot of people. Can I put instructions that show up when they log in, at the place where it says you need the instructor's approval? I thinkt that would help. BUt still does not solve the problem of going around in circles.

    Thanks so much for your assistance.



    If you are asking for help, provide lots of detail so problems can be reproduced.

    Things to describe:
    Operating system ATutor is installed on - Linux
    ATutor version -
    Patch #s applied -
    ATutor theme name - Default
    PHP version -
    MySQL version -
    Webserver & version -
    Copies of error messages -
    Changes to default settings -
    Web browser being used -
    ...and anything else relevant -


  • 2009-06-23 08:34:59

    Re: Payment Processing loop, unable to pay

    Our local version seems to be working ok.

    See if you can reproduce the blank page yourself?

    Is the course that requires payment set to Private in course properties?

    Are you able to view the error log for your web site, after the blank screen appears?

    Try replacing the module with a fresh copy. Perhaps a file has been corrupted.

    Se if

  • 2009-06-25 10:09:11

    Re: Payment Processing loop, unable to pay

    Is the previous issue resolved?

    Can you answer my question pls.

    My first thought is get yourself setup with MiraPay. PayPal is continually updating their service, and each time it ends up breaking the payment module. We've had to update it a half a dozen times since its initial release, and we're too occupied with other things right now to put more time in to the module. Mirapay has not changed at all since the initial release.

    Normally you'd edit language using the translator. See the translator documentation for info about using the translator to edit the existing instruction that appear in the feedback after enrolling in a course that requires payment. I'm not sure where you want to to put the instructions. Normally you look at the file name in your browser, then find the file in the ATutor source code.

    Re: Payment Processing loop, unable to pay

    Mirapay vs. paypal: I'll check on Mirapay if it can be used in the US?

    Editing using the translator:
    When users click on Browse Courses, then click on the course that requires payment, they get the message:

    The course you are trying to access is private. Enrollment in this course requires instructor approval.
    Request Enrollment.

    I only request enrollment because they need to pay. Therefore, I want to add the instructions for payment to this page. This is the url for this page:

    http://cultureadvantage.org/ATutor/users/private_enroll.php?course=39

    But I can't find it under the Atutor directory? Where is it located?

    Thanks.


  • 2009-06-26 16:38:47

    Re: Payment Processing loop, unable to pay

    The file is at ATutor/users/private_enroll.php

    I'd think you would be better off modifying the message languages. Normally it does get modified when the module is installed. Use the language manager to search for the current message, then edit it.

    Mar


  • 2009-06-28 12:23:43

    Re: Payment Processing loop, unable to pay

    As the administrator:

    System Preferences>Language>Editor
